item.title: Crossing the Language Barrier
item.description: Python and R: Let's Close the Gap! While both Python and R are really useful languages on their own, sometimes they work best together. In computational biology, it may be easier to visualize data through using "reticulate" so that Python and R can communicate with one another. It sounds challenging at first, but it's actually quite straightforward! We'll start of with a simple example! #R Code Chuck # "reticulate" is activated in R library(reticulate) # the object seasons is defined seasons <- "There are four seasons.
